column2: Ikiraro c' Uruzi rwa Oyapock ni ikiraro gifashwe n' imigozi. Gica Kuruzi Oyapock kugira gihuze ibisagara vya Oiapoque muri Brazil hamwe na Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock i Guiana y'ubu Faransa.

column1: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
column2: Iyo minara miremire ibiri igera ku metero 83 z' ubuhaguruke, na metero 378 z' uburebure kandi ifise n' inzira zibiri za m3.50 z' ubwaguke.

column1: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
column2: Ubuhaguruke musi y' ikiraro ni imetero 15. Inyubako yaheze muri Myandagaro 2011, kikaba kituguruye ingendo gushika muri Ntwarante 2017.

column1: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
column2: Ikiraro gitegekanywa gukora k' umugaragaro muri Nyakanga 2017, igenekerezo ama posita yo kugenzura ama duwane ya berezile yitezwe kuba yaheze.

column1: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
column2: Aba Guaraní ni numugwi w' abasangwa butaka ubu ari Paraguay y' ubuseruko, babaho nk' abahigi bameze nk' abatagira uburagamo bakora uburimyi bw' ivyo kurya.

column1: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
column2: Akarere ka Chaco kari muhira kiyindi migwi y' imiryango y'abasangwa butaka nkaba Guaycurú na Payaguá, batunzwe n' uruhigi ukwamura ivyamwa vyo mw' ishamba hamwe n' uburovyi.

column1: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
column2: Mukinjana ca 16, Paraguay, kera yitwa "Intara Nini y'Abahindi", yavutse kuguhura kw' abakoroni baba Espanyole n' imigwi y' abasangwa butaka.

column1: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
column2: Aba Espanyole batanguye ikiringo c' ubukoroni camaze ibinjana bitatu.

column1: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
column2: Guhera Asunción itangura mu 1537, Paraguay yaramenye kubika igice kinini kiyigize hamwe n' ibiyiranga kama.

column1: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
column2: Argentina irazwi cane mu kugira umwe mumigwi myiza hamwe n' abakinyi ba polo kw' isi.

column1: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
column2: Ihiganwa rikuru ry' umwaka riba muri Kigarama ku bibuga vya polo muri Las Cañitas.

column1: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
column2: Amahiganwa mato mato hamwe n' imipira bishobora navyonyene kuzobonwa aha mu bindi bihe vy' umwaka.

column1: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
column2: Kuri bishasha ku mahiganwa hamwe naho bagurira ama tike y' imipira ya polo, tumbera ishirahamwe Argentina rya Polo.

column1: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
column2: Ihera rikoreshwa naba Falklands ryitwa i Falkland pound (FKP) agaciro karyo kangana naki pound ry' Abongereza (GBP).

column1: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
column2: Amahera ashobora kuvunjwa mw' ibanke imwe mu mamazinga iri i Stanley harabana n' imangazine ya FIC West.

column1: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
column2: Ama pound y' Abongereza azokwemerwa mubisanzwe ahariho hose mumazinga hamwe ni karata z' ingurane za Stanley hamwe nama dolari ya Leta Zunze Ubumwe nayo nyene kenshi aremewe.

column1: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
column2: Kumazinga yo kumpera, amakarata y' ingurane ashobora kutazokwakirwa, naho amafaranga yo Mubwongereza no muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe ashobora kwakirwa; muvugane n'abanyeneho imbere kugira mumenye uburyo bwo kuriha bwemewe.

column1: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
column2: Bisa n' ibidashoboka kuvunjisha amahera yama Falklands inyuma yamazinga, rero muvunjishe amahera imbere yuko muva muma zinga.

column1: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
column2: Kuberako Montevideo iri mubu manuko bw' umurongo ugaburamwo isi ibice bibiri bingana, aho ni muci mugihe haba ari mugihe c'urubura Mugice co Hejuru y' Yisi hama bikaza birakuranwa.

column1: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
column2: Montevideo iri musi ya tropic; mugihe mumezi y' ici, ubushuhe buri hejuru ya +30°C ari ubusanzwe.

column1: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
column2: Igihe c' ubukonje gishobora kubabesha ko kiryoshe: Ubushuhe buja gake munsi yo kuba urubura, ariko umuyaga ukanye urihuza bigatera kwumva hakanye gusumba uko igipimo c'ubushuhe gitanga.

column1: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
column2: Ntihabaho igihe gusa "c' imvura" ni "c' ici": urugero rw' imvura ruhakwa kuguma ari rumwe mumwaka wose.

column1: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
column2: Naho ibikoko vyinshi vyo muri iyo parike bimenyereye abantu, ni ibinyeshamba kandi nta wukwiye kubigaburira canke kubigora.

column1: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
column2: Abakuru b'iparike bavuga ko ukwiye kuguma n'imiburiburi kuri yadi/metero 100 kure y'amadubu n'amabingira, no kuri yadi/metero 25 kure y'ibindi bikoko vyose vy'ibinyeshamba!

column1: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
column2: Igikoko citwa bison, impongo yitwa wapiti, iyitwa élan, idubu n'ibindi bikoko binini nka vyose, birashobora kukugirira nabi naho womengo biratekereje.

column1: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
column2: Buri mwaka, ingenzi zitari nke zirakomereka kubera zitahagaze aho zari zikwiye guhagarara. Ivyo bikoko ni binini, ni ibinyeshamba kandi birashobora kukugirira nabi, rero vyubahirize uhagarare nka hariya.

column1: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
column2: Menya kandi ko akamoto gakwega amadubu n'ibindi bikoko. Rero wirinde kugendana canke guteka imfungurwa zimota cane, kandi wamane isuku kw'ihema ryawe.

column1: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
column2: Apia ni wo mugwa mukuru wa Samoa. Ico gisagara kiri kw'izinga rya Upolu, kikaba kibamwo abantu bari munsi gato ya 40.000.

column1: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
column2: Apia yatangujwe mu myaka ya 1850. Ni wo murwa mukuru wa Samoa kuva mu 1959.

column1: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
column2: Ku kivuko caho ni ho habereye ikintu uguhangana gukomeye kw'amato mu 1889, igihe amato y'Abadagi, y'Abanyamerika n'ay'Abongereza yanka kuhava.

column1: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
column2: Amato yose yaratewe aribira, kiretse ubwato bumwe bunyaruka bw'Abongereza. Hapfuye abantu hafi 200 b'Abanyamerika n'Abadagi.

column1: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
column2: Mu gihe c'urugamba rwo guharanira ukwikura rwatunganijwe n'umuhari wa Mau, ikoraniro ry'abantu batekanye ryabereye mu gisagara ryavuyemwo iyiciwa ry'umukuru kizigenza Tupua Tamasese Lealofi wa 3.

column1: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
column2: Hari ibibanza vyinshi vyo ku nkengera, kuko akarere ka Okulande gafise ibivuko bibiri. Ahazwi cane hari mu burere butatu.

column1: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
column2: Inkengera z'ikiyaga za North Shore (mu karere ka North Harbour) ziherereye kw’ibahari Pasifike, hakaba hatangurira i Long Bay mu buraruko gushika i Devonport mu bumanuko.

column1: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
column2: Kuri izo nkengera nka zose hari umusenyi, ukwoga nta kaga birimwo, kandi henshi hari igitutu gitangwa n’ibiti vyitwa pohutukawa.

column1: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
column2: Ku nkengera zitwa Tamaki Drive haherereye ku kivuko ca Waitemata, mu makaritiye ateye imbere ya Mission Bay n'aya hantu hitiriwe umweranda Heliyeri muri Okulande yo hagati.

column1: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
column2: Rimwe na rimwe usanga hagenderwa cane n’imiryango hakaba hariho n’utubutike dutandukanye dutonze ku nkengera. Kwoga mu mazi nta ngorane bitera.

column1: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta".
column2: Inzoga nyamukuru yaho yitwa 'Number One', inzoga idahanitse, yamara iryoshe kandi imara inyota. Iyindi nzoga yaho yitwa "Manta".

column1: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
column2: Hari imivinyu myinshi yo mu Bufaransa iboneka, mugabo iyo muri Nouvelle Zélande na Ositaraliya ni yo wosanga itononekara kubera ingendo.

column1: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
column2: Amazi y'aho yo kw'ibombo ni meza cane urashobora kuyanywa, mugabo ufise amakenga biroroshe kuronka aho ugurira ayo mw'icupa.

column1: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
column2: Ku bantu bo muri Ositaraliya, ntibamenyereye ikawa yitwa plat blanc. Ico bita 'espresso' iba ari ikawa ya espresso yoroheje. Iyitwa cappuccino bayiguha yuzuyeko urubu (atari ifurofuro), icayi na co bakakiguha kitagira amata.

column1: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
column2: Shokola ishushe ikorwa kibiligi. Imitobe y'ivyamwa irazimvye mugabo ni myiza cane.

column1: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
column2: Mu mwaka wose, abantu benshi baraja aho hantu harundanye ibinyabuzima vyo mu mazi, kandi ni gake abantu bahakomerekera kubera ivyo bikoko.

column1: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
column2: Yamara, urabaza ababijejwe, ukurikize ivyapa vyose, kandi ntiwirengagize amabwirizwa yo kwikingira.

column1: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
column2: Ibikoko vyitwa méduses-boîtes biboneka hafi y'inkengera z'ibahari canke aho ibahari ihurira n'uruzi, kuva muri Gitugutu gushika muri Ndamukiza mu buraruko bwa 1770. Birashika bikaboneka no mu bindi biringo.

column1: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
column2: Naho hariho ibikoko vyitwa requins, ni gake bitera abantu. Vyinshi biratinya abantu bigaca vyigira.

column1: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
column2: Ingona zo mw'ibahari ntiziba cane mw'ibahari. Ziba canecane aho inzuzi zihurira n'ibahari, mu buraruko uvuye i Rockhampton.

column1: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
column2: Gufata icumba imbere y'igihe biratuma uwuzofata urugendo atekana kuko aba azi ko atazobura uburaro ashiteyo.

column1: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
column2: Abakora ivy'ingendo kenshi baragirana amasezerano n'amahoteri kanaka. Ariko hari igihe uba ushobora gufatisha ubundi buraro biciye ku muntu akora ivy'ingendo, nk'akarorero aho gushinga ihema.

column1: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
column2: Abakora ivy'ingendo kenshi baratunganya ivy'icayi, ukwiyunguruza uja canke uva ku kibuga c'indege, canke mbere bagafatanya ivy'urugendo rw'indege n'ivy'amahoteli.

column1: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
column2: Barashobora no kuba barakubikiye ikibanza nimba ukeneye umwanya wo kuvyiyumvira canke wo kurondera izindi mpapuro z'urugendo (nk'akarorero viza).

column1: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
column2: Ariko ivyo uhinduza canke usaba ukwiye kubicisha ku wujejwe ivy'urugendo aho kwitura bene ihoteli ubwabo.

column1: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
column2: Ku bijanye n'amasabukuru amwamwe, benshi cane mu bitaba amasabukuru y'umuziki bashima gucumbika ahabera ibirori, kandi benshi babona ko kubikora bihambaye.

column1: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
column2: Ushaka rero kwibera hafi y'aho ibirori bibera, utegerezwa kuhashika kare ukaba urarondera ikibanza co gucumbikamwo hafi y'umuziki.

column1: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
column2: Wibuke ko naho igiteramo kiba caheze, hashobora kuba abantu bitavye uwo musi mukuru babandanya kuvuza umuziki gushika ijoro ryitereye.

column1: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
column2: Abatunganya amasabukuru amwamwe barategekaniriza abafise abana ibibanza bidasanzwe vyo gucumbikamwo.

column1: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
column2: Nimba uzoba uriko ujabuka ikiyaga Baltique co mu Buraruko mu rushana, uzorabe ikibanza co muri kabine, kuko guca mu bibarafu bitera urwamo rwinshi rubuza amahoro abarwumva cane.

column1: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
column2: Kugira ingendo mu bwato uja Saint Petersburg birimwo no gutembera mu gisagara. Abagendera muri ayo mato ntibasabwa viza (raba amasezerano).

column1: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
column2: Mu bisanzwe kazino nta ko zitagira ngo zungukire cane ku mwanya abajayo bahamara no ku mahera yabo. Kenshi usanga ata madirisha canke amasaha yo ku ruhome bihari, n'imiryango isohoka ikaba igoye gutora.

column1: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
column2: Usanga kenshi hari imfungurwa, ibinyobwa n'ibikino bidasanzwe kugira abahagendera babandanye kuryoherwa, bahagume.

column1: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
column2: Kazino zimwezimwe usanga zitanga inzoga ku buntu. Ariko rero uborewe ntusubira kwiyumvira neza, kandi nta mukinyi mwiza w'akamari ayobewe akamaro ko kugumana ubwenge buri ku murongo.

column1: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures.
column2: Uwipfuza kugenda n'umuduga aciye ahantu hahanamye canke mu nzira zica ku nkike y'umusozi akwiye kwiyumvira ko hashobora kugwa neje, ibarafu, canke imbeho nyinshi cane.

column1: On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt.
column2: Ku mabarabara ariko ibirafu canke neje, ntushobora kunyonga nk'uko ubigira kw'ikaburimbi kuko amapine adafata neza hasi.

column1: During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time.
column2: Igihe hari igihuhusi ca neje, mu kanya isase harashobora kugwa neje yokubuza kugenda.

column1: Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows.
column2: Iyo neje iguye canke igahuhuta, umwuka uri mu muyaga ugacika amazi canke hakirema ibarafu ku madirisha y'umuduga, na ho nyene kubona imbere vyogorana.

column1: On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.
column2: Ku rundi ruhande, mu bihugu vyinshi ibihe vy'ibibarafu canke neje usanga ari ibisanzwe, kandi ni gake abantu bareka kwiyunguruza, umwaka wose.

column1: Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors.
column2: Ingendo zo kuraba ibikoko bishobora kuba ari co kintu ca mbere kizana ingenzi muri Afrika kandi kikaryohera benshi muri bo.

column1: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna.
column2: Ijambo safari rirakunda gukoreshwa bashaka kuvuga ingendo zo hasi zo kuraba ibikoko bitangaje vyo muri Afrika, canecane mw'ishamba ry'umukenke.

column1: Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing.
column2: Ibikoko bimwebimwe, nk'inzovu n'imisumbarembe, birakunda kwegera cane imiduga. Ufise ivyuma bisanzwe, urashobora kuvyitegereza neza.

column1: Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars.
column2: Intambwe, ingwe zitwa guépards n'izitwa léopards hari igihe bigira udusoni. Wobibona neza ukoresheje amatarubindi.

column1: A walking safari (also called a "bush walk", "hiking safari", or going "footing") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days.
column2: Isafari y'amaguru (canke "kugendagenda mw'ishamba", "isafari yo gutambuka", canke kugenda "n'amaguru") ni ugutambuka, yaba amasaha make canke imisi nk'ingahe.

column1: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan.
column2: Amahiganwa mpuzamakungu y'abafise ubumuga azoba itariki 24 Myandagaro gushika 5 Nyakanga 2021. Hari ibizobera mu bindi bibanza hirya no hino mu Buyapani.

column1: Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964.
column2: Tokyo kizoba co gisagara conyene co muri Aziya cakiriye kabiri Inkino za Olempike zo mu ci, kikaba carazakiriye mu 1964.

column1: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.
column2: Nimba waguza amatike y'indege n'uburaro ku bwa 2020 bataratangaza ko vyungurujwe, hari aho utokwororerwa.

column1: Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled.
column2: Amategeko ajanye no gusivya urugendo aratandukanye, mugabo twisunze ivya vuba muri Ntwarante, menshi mu mategeko ajanye no gusivya ingendo kubera koronavirisi ntashika muri Mukakaro 2020, igihe inkino za Olempike zigizwa inyuma.

column1: It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.
column2: Vyitezwe ko amatike menshi y'ivyo birori azogurwa amayapani ari hagati ya 2.500 na 130.000, amatike asanzwe akagurwa nka 7.000.

column1: Ironing damp clothes can help them dry. Many hotels have an iron and ironing board available for loan, even if one is not present in the room.
column2: Kugorora impuzu zitose birafasha kuzumutsa. Amahoteri menshi usanga afise ipasi n'ico bagororerako wokwitiza, n'igihe ata yiba ihari mu cumba urimwo.

column1: If an iron isn't available, or if you don't fancy wearing ironed socks, then you can try using a hairdryer, if available.
column2: Usanze ata pasi ihari canke ukaba udashaka kwambara amashesheti agoroye, urashobora gukoresha icuma cumutsa umushatsi nimba kihari.

column1: Be careful not to allow fabric to become too hot (which can cause shrinkage, or in extreme cases, scorch).
column2: Uraba maso ntureke ngo impuzu ishuhe cane (kuko ishobora guca yituna canke mbere igasha).

column1: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats.
column2: Hari uburyo butandukanye bwo gutyorora amazi, bumwebumwe bukaba ari bwo buhasha ingeramizi kanaka.

column1: In some areas boiling water for a minute is enough, in others several minutes are needed.
column2: Hamwehamwe usanga guteka amazi umunota umwe bihagije, ahandi ugasanga ukenera kuyateka iminota nk'ingahe yose.

column1: Filters vary in effectiveness, and should you have a concern, then you should consider buying your water in a sealed bottle from a reputable company.
column2: Ubuyungiro ntibunganya ubushobozi, mugabo ugize amakenga wokwiyumvira kugura amazi yo mw'icupa ahingurwa n'ishirahamwe rizwi neza.

column1: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions.
column2: Ingenzi zirashobora guhura n'udukoko zitamenyereye iwabo.

column1: Pests can spoil food, cause irritation, or in a worse case cause allergic reactions, spread venom, or transmit infections.
column2: Udukoko turashobora kwonona imfungurwa, tugatuma usasatwa, canke vyakomeye tugatuma uhurirwa, tugakwiragiza ubumara canke imigera.

column1: Infectious diseases themselves, or dangerous animals that can injure or kill people by force, do not usually qualify as pests.
column2: Indwara zandukira ubwazo canke ibikoko biteye akaga bishobora gukoresha inguvu bigakomeretsa umuntu canke bikamwica, mu bisanzwe ntibija muri uwo mugwi.

column1: Duty free shopping is the opportunity to buy goods exempted from taxes and excises at certain locations.
column2: Kugura ibintu ata makori biraguha akaryo ko kugura ibintu bitarihishwa amakori canke amatagisi, mu bibanza bimwebimwe.

column1: Travellers bound for countries with heavy taxation can sometimes save a considerable amount of money, especially on products such as alcoholic beverages and tobacco.
